page.title: 05Education in Portstewart
page.content: The town is served by two primary schools-St.Colum's Maintained Primary School and Portstewart Controlled Primary School. The only Secondary school in the town is Dominican College which draws its intake mainly from St.Colum's and St.Patrick's,Portrush-although some pupils also go from Portstewart Controlled Primary. Pupils from St.Colum's who do not transfer to Dominican will go to St.Joseph's Secondary School in Coleraine. The boys from the controlled primary go to either Coleraine Academical Institution or the Boys Secondary while the girls go to Coleraine High School or the Girls Secondary School. A few children go to Dalriada in Ballymoney or Dunluce in Bushmills. Throughout secondary schooling most children must travel daily by bus.
